column3: ut non delìnqŭam in lingŭa mea~; pósui ori meo custódiam
column4: qŭum consìsteret peccátor advèrsum me.~»^ I said
column5: "I will take heed to my ways
column6: that I sin not with my tongue~; I have set a guard to my mouth
column7: when the sinner stood against me."

column4: et dolor meus renovátus est. ^ I was dumb
column6: and kept silence from good things

column2: et in meditațióne mea exardéscet ìgnis. ^ My heart grew hot within me
column3: and in my meditation a fire shall flame out.

column5: et númerum diérum meórum qŭìs est
column6: ut sciam qŭid desit mìhi.~»^ I spoke with my tongue
column10: and what is the number of my days
column11: that I may know what is wanting to me."

column2: et substánția mea tamqŭam nìhilum ante te. Verùmtamen univèrsa vánitas
column3: òmnis hòmo vívens. ^ Behold thou hast made my days measurable
column4: and my substance is as nothing before thee. Surely all things are vanity

column1: 7 ^ Verùmtamen in imáǧine pertránsit hòmo~; sed et frustre conturbátur. Tesáŭrisat
column2: et ignórat cui congregábit ea. ^ Surely man passeth as an image~; but even he is disquieted in vain. He storeth up
column3: and he knoweth not for whom he shall gather these things.

column1: 8 ^ ¿~Et nunc qŭaĕ est expectáțio mea~? ¿~Nonne Dòminus~? Et substánția mea apud te est. ^ And now what is my hope~? Is it not the Lord~? And my substance is with thee.
9 ^ Ab òmnibus iniqŭitátibus meîs érue me~; oppróbrium insapiènti dedìsti me. ^ Deliver thou me from all my iniquities~; thou hast made me a reproach to the fool.

column3: qŭóniam tu fecìsti. ^ I was dumb
column4: and I opened not my mouth

column1: 11 ^ Ámove a me plagas tuas~; a fortitúdine manûs tuaĕ ego deféci in increpațiónibus. ^ Remove thy scourges from me~; the strength of thy hand hath made me faint in rebukes.

column2: et tabéscere fecìsti sicut aráneam ánimam ejus~; verùmtamen vane conturbátur òmnis hòmo. ^ Thou hast corrected man for iniquity
column3: and thou hast made his soul to waste away like a spider~; surely in vain is any man disquieted.
et deprecațiónem meam~; áŭribus pèrcipe lácrimas meas. Ne sìleas
column4: qŭóniam ádvena ego sum apud te
column5: et peregrínus sicut òmnes patres mei. ^ Hear my prayer
column7: and my supplication~; give ear to my tears. Be no silent
column8: for I am a stranger with thee
column9: and a sojourner as all my fathers were.

column3: et ámplius non èro. ^ Forgive me
column4: that I may be refreshed before I go hence
